description: Typed solutions to open-ended mathematical problems focusing on communication of ideas and correctness. Involves solving questions using Word/LaTeX with feedback provided.
50-minute in-person test assessing mastery of weeks 1-5 content (real numbers, sequences, limits, continuity). Held during Week 7 class.
2-hour comprehensive exam during official university examination period covering all course topics (limits, continuity, differentiation, integration).
Two-part submission: initial draft solutions to foundational problems (3%) and revised solutions demonstrating course learning (7%). Combines handwritten and typed components with reflection.
